Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I

Biography: Mr. D has dedicated over 12 years to working with children and youth, pouring his heart into helping them grow both personally and spiritually. As the Youth Director at his church, he is passionate about teaching young people about Jesus Christ and guiding them in their faith journey. Known for his patience, leadership, and genuine love for kids, Mr. D creates a positive and encouraging environment where youth feel valued, supported, and inspired to live out their purpose.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Captain Alicia "Lea" Brooks is a dedicated Captain of The Salvation Army, known for her deep love for the Lord Jesus Christ and her unwavering commitment to serving others. With a heart rooted in faith, she leads with compassion, humility, and strength, always seeking to reflect Christ in her words and actions. Her passion for service extends beyond her calling—she is a devoted and loving mother who works tirelessly to nurture, guide, and support her family. A hard worker in every sense, she approaches each responsibility with excellence, perseverance, and grace, inspiring those around her through both her leadership and her life.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Captain Jeffrey "Jeff" Brooks is a faithful Captain in The Salvation Army, recognized for his strong work ethic and his readiness to help with whatever needs to be done. With a sincere love for Jesus Christ, he leads the local church in humble submission to the Lord, seeking God’s guidance in every aspect of ministry and life. Known for his kindness, he is always willing to share a warm smile and an encouraging word with those he meets. Beyond his calling, he is a devoted and loving father to his children and a supportive, caring husband to Captain Lea. His life and leadership reflect servant-hearted dedication, integrity, and Christlike love.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Mr. Brent Gardner serves as the dedicated groundskeeper and maintenance man of our community center, a role that is vital to the daily life and success of our ministry. Quite simply, our community center would not run without him. A tireless hard worker, he approaches every task with excellence, care, and pride, ensuring that the grounds and facilities are safe, welcoming, and well maintained. Rooted in his love for the Lord, he views his work as an act of service, faithfully giving his best each day. He is known for his willingness to lend a helping hand, often stepping in wherever help is needed and doing whatever needs to be done without hesitation. His passion, dependability, and servant’s heart make him an invaluable blessing to our community and a quiet example of faith lived out through action.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Mrs. Sherry Garner is a lifelong member of The Salvation Army, deeply rooted in both its mission and its history within the community. Her family’s legacy is closely woven into the foundation of this community center, as her father played a major role in its building and development. This heritage has shaped her deep understanding and unwavering commitment to the ministry. Well versed in all the ins and outs of the organization, Mrs. Garner brings invaluable knowledge, wisdom, and steadiness to every area she serves. She oversees the senior ministry with care and dedication, faithfully nurturing relationships and creating meaningful opportunities for connection, service, and spiritual growth. Always willing to do what needs to be done, she serves with humility and consistency. Often working behind the scenes, she is a quiet force who helps keep the ministry in the area moving forward. Her dedication, reliability, and servant’s heart continue to be a blessing to The Salvation Army and the community it serves.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg

Biography:
Mrs. Tiffany Blanton is a dedicated Youth Development Professional who has faithfully served in our afterschool program and summer camps for over three years. Her heart for children is evident in everything she does, as she has a remarkable ability to connect with young people through patience, kindness, and understanding. She creates a safe, encouraging environment where children feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow.

Guided by her love for the Lord Jesus Christ, Mrs. Blanton serves with generosity and compassion, always willing to give of herself for the benefit of others. She is known for being helpful, loving, and charitable, and for offering kind, empathetic words exactly when they are needed most. Through her faith, her dedication, and her genuine care for children and families, she continues to make a lasting and meaningful impact on the lives she touches.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

PositionTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager
Biography: Ms. Peyton Sealy serves as the Program Manager of The Red Shield Youth Center, bringing with her over a decade of experience working with children and families. Her extensive background and deep commitment to youth development are evident in the care, structure, and excellence of every program under her leadership. She faithfully oversees each program involving children at the center, ensuring that they are safe, meaningful, and rooted in strong Christ-centered values. Her faith in Jesus Christ influences everything she does, shaping her approach to leadership, service, and relationships. In addition to her work with youth, Ms. Peyton is also actively involved in the senior ministry, reflecting her heart for God's children of all ages. Known for her servant leadership, empathy, and Christlike compassion, she leads by example—serving others, loving one another, and uplifting those around her with grace and integrity. Her dedication and faithful stewardship continue to make a lasting impact on the center and the community it serves.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Spartanburg

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Area Director I

Biography: Ms. Hope Allen-Jones brings extensive experience to her role, drawing on her years of service as a counselor in Henderson, North Carolina. She has also served as a preschool teacher with the Head Start program, where she cultivated a deep commitment to supporting the growth and development of young children. Ms. Allen-Jones earned her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from North Carolina A&T State University in 2020. In her personal time, she enjoys spending time with her family, singing, and appreciating the outdoors.

In 2008 I became the club director at the Hazel Center. During 2019 and before Covid began I became the director over Oak Street and Hazel Center. I attended and coached basketball, football, baseball and lacrosse at the Oak Street Club.

Biography:
Kelsey Biggers has been working at The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center since September 2022. She has a Bachelors of Music in Music Performance and a Master of Arts in Teaching. 

She describes herself as compassionate and driven to inspire lifelong followers of Christ. She demonstrates devotion to youth empowerment with a focus on nurturing spiritual, emotional, physical, and academic development to promote long-term success. She is trained in providing individualized support, developing youth-centered programs, and delivering exceptional service. She is always eager to further a career in nurturing, developing, and inspiring youth.

He is passionate, fun, and loving, yet firm when necessary. Josh is a phenomenal role model for staff and youth, alike. He strives to provide a safe, loving, and fun environment where we can help every child grow spiritually, mentally, and emotionally.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
I hold a Master’s degree in Early Childhood Development and have over four years of experience as a program director. As a Florida native, I am passionate about creating nurturing environments where children feel safe, confident, and inspired to learn. I believe children thrive best through play, exploration, and meaningful peer-to-peer interaction, and I strive to support both their academic and social-emotional growth every day.
“Intelligence plus character—that is the goal of true education."- Dr, Martin Luther King Jr.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Coordinator

Biography:
I have been part of the club for two and a half years, joining in just the second week after it officially opened. During that time, I have had the opportunity to watch the club grow and evolve, as well as witness the incredible growth and change of the kids I started with. Being able to continue that journey alongside some of the best people I’ve ever met has been truly special. This club has been life-changing for me in more ways than one, and it is a place I will always hold close to my heart. 

"Sometimes you don’t realize the impact of a place until it becomes a part of who you are.” -Anonymous

John Korp is dedicated to nurturing the potential of every child he works with at the Red Shield Youth Center. With a passion for youth development, John coordinates programs designed to build strong character, develop essential life skills, and refine scholastic abilities.  His work focuses on fostering mental, emotional and spiritual growth, creating an environment where children feel valued, supported, and inspired to achieve their best. Through his commitment 
and compassion, John continues to make a lasting impact on the lives of the young people he serves.

She leads craft activities that inspire children to explore their imagination, express themselves, and build confidence through hands-on projects. Katie strives to make each child feel special and valued, focusing on their individual strengths and unique qualities. Through her warm and encouraging approach, she helps every child discover the joy of creativity and the confidence that comes from being uniquely themselves.

With patience and positivity, Patricia fosters an environment where children can develop both their minds and their character.

Tracy started at the Red Shield Youth Center in September of 2025 after coming from a career spanning two decades in the Parks and Recreation field. Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Coordinator I

Biography: Holly Toney is the Program Coordinator at the Red Shield Youth Center. She has worked with children now for over a year and a half. Before this role, felt blessed to be a stay-at-home mom and now has the honor of being with the Salvation Army since they opened the new building in April, 2024. It has been a huge blessing for both her and our community! In her free time she enjoys being active outside, baking and spending time with her boys.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
Born in Beckley, West Virginia, Brian Nabors is a 1992 graduate of Woodrow Wilson High School, where he earned All-State honors in basketball. He went on to the University of Charleston, completing a bachelor’s degree in psychology while serving as team captain and earning All-Conference recognition.
Brian has dedicated his life to education, youth development, and community service. He spent eight years at Pressley Ridge Schools as a Family Service Coordinator, teacher-counselor, and behavior specialist. For the past 18 years, he has served Raleigh County Schools as a behavior specialist, alternative education teacher, and special education teacher.
With 29 years of coaching experience, Brian is the current head girls’ basketball coach at his alma mater, Woodrow Wilson High School.
Widely known for his integrity, faith, and heart for service, Brian is described as a man of God who pursues the Lord with sincerity.

She likes to spend her free time with her family and has a love for singing and all things music.

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond

Biography: I have been employed with The Salvation Army for forty-two years. My first position was the physical director because of my longevity, dedication, caring, sacrifice in the developing of our youth, and the love for our community and youth. I was honored with a street (Harold Harris St.) by the community leaders, the alumni of the c.c.o.t.e.r, and the community. I am grateful, appreciative, thankful and blessed for this honor. The development of our youth is the reason why I do what I do. Physically, mentally, socially and spiritually.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Coordinator

Biography:
JaReese Arrington also known as Coach Ja. I am both honored and excited to have the opportunity to serve you and the families of our community. My background and experience spans from working as after-school program staff to serving as program director for various organizations. This range has provided me not only with the skills to effectively lead a program but also with a deep understanding of the day-to-day experiences of working directly with youth.
A few interesting facts about myself would be that I love anime, Marvel and DC (comics/movies/characters), as well as music and dance. I am a professional dancer/choreographer as well as a DJ. I also have great experiences playing and coaching sports such as football, basketball, and track & field.
My style may be a bit unorthodox, as my primary focus isn't solely on how smoothly a program runs, but rather on the quality of the experience provided to youth and families like yours. I like to utilize my background and experience in music, dance, and athletics to create a fun and engaging environment for everyone to enjoy.

Beyond cleanliness, I create a space that is comfortable, productive, and welcoming for daily activities. My job is more than a responsibility—it is a commitment to ensuring that every child has a safe, clean, and healthy environment to work, learn, and play."

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Biography:
Hugh Jones has served with The Salvation Army for over 32 years, including 25 years as Director of the Red Shield Youth Center in Richmond, Virginia. His commitment to youth development began in his own childhood at the Boys Club of Richmond, where he experienced firsthand the transformative impact of caring mentors and meaningful programs.

After attending Virginia Commonwealth University where he studied Public Relations and Mass Communication, he went on to work with several ministries, applying his skills while deepening his sense of purpose. His journey with The Salvation Army started when he was asked to teach a photography class at the former Salvation Army Boys & Girls Club. What began as an eight-week session evolved into a lifelong calling to serve youth, as Hugh could see himself and the needs of the youth he served.

Believing that youth ministry reflects the heart of God, Hugh is passionate about fostering growth in spirit, mind, and body among the children and teens who attend the Red Shield Youth Center and beyond. His leadership continues to create a safe, nurturing environment where young people can thrive and reach their full potential.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond

Biography: I am passionate about working with youth and take pride in helping them grow into responsible, confident individuals. Currently pursuing my master’s degree in Elementary Education, I am strengthening my skills and applying new strategies to create meaningful learning experiences. My daily engagement with students inspires me to explore innovative approaches that foster both academic and personal development. With a strong commitment to building relationships and cultivating supportive environments, I strive to make a lasting impact on the lives of young learners.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond

Biography: Mary started with our Area Command helping out in the kitchen, and now she’s joined us to share her bright smiles and nutritious meals with our Red Shield Youth members. From Monday to Friday, she prepares kid-friendly meals and serves them hot right as the students walk out of school. First up are the elementary kids, who are buzzing with excitement to see what’s on the menu, followed by the teens. Mary loves being a blessing to everyone who breezes into the cafeteria. She understands how important a good meal is before we kick off Center activities after school, and she knows how the long summer days benefit from a nourishing bite, a little energy, and the chance to enjoy food and share time around the table with friends.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Shreveport
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I

PositionTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I
Biography:
Mariam Harley will play a key role in launching our new STEM initiative. She demonstrates strong leadership through her extensive experience as a mother, entrepreneur, community organizer, and survivor. This background inspires confidence in her ability to guide this effort. Mariam's academic qualifications, which include a Bachelor of Arts in Sociology from Louisiana State University and a Master of Arts in Public Administration from Liberty University, provide a solid foundation for understanding societal needs and developing effective community-based solutions.

In addition to her STEM initiatives, Mariam's background in social services, mental health, and community organizing uniquely positions her to address the holistic needs of the children and families we serve. Her roles as a Mental Health Specialist and Social Service Analyst, along with her work as a Community Organizer, highlight her profound ability to manage complex cases, provide crisis intervention, foster community engagement, and advocate for policy change. Mariam's expertise in project management, stakeholder engagement, and communication aligns well with our mission to "do the most good" and reflects the spirit of compassion and service in action.

As Proverbs 22:6 reminds us, "Train a child in the way he should go; even when he is old he will not depart from it." By integrating faith-based values with comprehensive educational programming, this initiative will equip children with essential 21st-century skills while instilling a strong moral compass and sense of purpose. Mariam's extensive experience in social services, mental health, and community organizing ensures a holistic approach, reassuring stakeholders of her ability to address the diverse developmental needs of children and actively engage families and the broader community.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Shreveport

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Biography:
Coach C took over the program in February of 2022, and it has continued to grow and thrive under his leadership. He has used his marketing skills to help grow the program by more than 200 students over four years. A native of Miami, Florida, Coach C is of Haitian descent and is the son of Alphonse and Antoinette Cherfils. He earned a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from Shorter University in 2014, a Master of Education from Midland University in 2016, and a Master of Arts in Leadership from the University of Jamestown in 2018.

Coach C has over 15 years of experience working with youth and teens through track and field coaching, youth leadership, and serving as a camp counselor at Jamestown First Assembly in Jamestown, North Dakota. He is passionate about helping young people grow both on and off the field.

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Biography: I have 35 years of experience working in youth development. In turn I have developed academic support, enrichment, recreation, life skills and sports programs for all youth age groups and demographics. During my tenure I have been able to touch so many lives in a positive manner by assisting them in overcoming many obstacles. I am driven to find ways to positively impact residents in our community to live a healthy and prosperous life through our Christian based family oriented programs here at RSYC.

Author.Department: The Salvation Army of Houston - Garden City
Author.JobTitle: Youth Development Professional

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
Elena Nipper has been a valued member of The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center team for nearly two years. She brings a wide range of experience teaching youth across multiple subjects, with a special passion for art and creative expression. Elena has a natural ability to connect with children and encourage them to explore their talents while building confidence and life skills.

Grounded in her strong faith, Elena has a deep love for God and is passionate about sharing His love through service, encouragement, and mentorship. When she is not working with youth, Elena dedicates her time to caring for her grandmother and father, reflecting her strong sense of family and compassion. At home, she is also kept company by her beloved cat, who adds a little extra joy to her days.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
Audrey Gomez has served as a Youth Development Professional at The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center for nearly two years. Although young in age, Audrey has been connected to The Salvation Army since her teenage years, giving her a deep understanding of the organization’s mission and a genuine passion for serving youth.

Audrey’s enthusiasm and positive energy are felt throughout the Center. She especially enjoys planning and leading her “Adventures with Audrey” sessions, where creativity, exploration, and fun come together to engage youth in meaningful ways. Her ability to connect with children and teens allows her to build strong relationships while creating an environment where youth feel encouraged, supported, and excited to participate.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: I have been enjoying my time working with the Red Shield Youth Center. I am passionate about creating a fun and safe environment while building strong healthy relationships with both students and coworkers. I love getting to know each child and watching their personalities shine. One of the best parts of my job is seeing the excitement on their faces when they learn something for the first time. Making their after-school experience enjoyable is very important to me.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: I live by the phrase "be the change you want to see in the world." I empower improvement and personal growth in myself and others. My dream is to work at a zoo as an exhibit educator teaching kids about the environment and the role we have in conservation. My hobbies outside of work include kayak, fishing, photograpghy and video games.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: I love and have a passion for what I do with Red Shield youth Center. My favorite parts of the job are being able to connect and interact with all children of different backgrounds. I enjoy having fun while making sure the children are safe and supported. We are all different in our own ways and we all deserve to feel included, supported, and valued.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: My first job working with children was with Warren County Public School transporting students with special needs. I have also taught Sunday School and taught student praise dance at church. My job at Red Shield Youth Center gives me joy through seeing progress in students social and thinking skills. I have developed great relationships as my goal is to make a positive difference in each of their lives. My have motto is: "I can do all things through Christ that strengthens me."

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Captains Mike and Rebecca McGee currently serve as the Corps Officers at the Salvation Army Charlotte Temple Corps on Marsh Road. In that capacity, they pastor and lead the Salvation Army church and administrate the Marsh Road Red Shield Youth Center. The McGee’s served previously as the Corps Officers in Burlington, NC from 2019-2021, and as Corps Officers in Rock Hill, SC from 2016-2019.

Author.JobTitle: Digital Media Coordinator

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Lieutenants Isaiah and Rachel Rector serve as the Corps Officers at The Salvation Army Charlotte Belmont Corps on Belmont Avenue. In that capacity, they pastor and lead The Salvation Army church and administrate the Belmont Avenue Red Shield Youth Center. Lt. Isaiah Rector was commissioned as a Salvation Army Officer in 2023 from The Salvation Army Evangeline Booth College.

Author.JobTitle: Digital Media Coordinator

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: I truly love working at the Red Shield Youth Center. Being there gives me a chance to connect with kids, support them, and help create a safe and positive environment where they can feel comfortable and encouraged. Every day is different, which makes the work exciting and meaningful for me. Whether I'm help with activities, offering guidance, or simply being someone they can talk to, I feel proud to be part of a place that makes a real difference in young people's lives.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: I enjoy working with Red Shield Youth Center and building community within the Center. I have grown to have a passion for working with youth and helping to create a safe and positive space where children can grow and feel supported. My favorite part of my job is building connections with children and being a part of an organization that makes a difference in their lives.

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Biography: Vicky Leasure serves as the Director of The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of Allegany County. She oversees after-school programs, youth development initiatives, and community outreach focused on creating safe, supportive spaces for children and families. Vicky is passionate about character building, education, and helping youth discover their potential. She is committed to strengthening families and building a stronger community through service and mentorship.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Lt. Risa serves as a Salvation Army Officer, where she supports youth programs and community engagement. Originally from Oklahoma, she loves Jesus and is passionate about building meaningful relationships with youth and families. Lt. Risa enjoys reading, values her friends and family, and in another life would be a storm chaser, drawn to adventure and the beauty of God’s creation.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Karen Wells serves as the Office Manager at The Salvation Army in Cumberland, where she plays a vital role in ensuring daily operations run smoothly behind the scenes. She is a key support for food pantry services, social services, Angel Tree, and camp programs, and is always willing to step in wherever help is needed. Karen has been involved with The Salvation Army’s after-school and summer camp programs for many years and remains a steady, caring presence for staff, youth, and families alike.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter SC
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Biography:
Crystal Brown serves as the Site Director at our center, bringing dedication, leadership, and a passion for youth development to every program. With extensive experience in community engagement and education, Crystal ensures that each child has a safe, supportive, and enriching environment to learn, grow, and thrive.
She is committed to fostering strong relationships with families, staff, and the community, and she works tirelessly to create programs that inspire curiosity, confidence, and creativity in every participant.
Outside of her role at the center, Crystal enjoys fishing, shopping and spending time with her grandkids, which reflects her belief in balancing hard work with fun and meaningful connections.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter SC

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter SC
Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Coordinator

Biography:
Madison Ardis is the Program Coordinator at our center, dedicated to creating engaging, educational, and fun programs for all participants. She works closely with staff, families, and students to ensure that every activity runs smoothly and meets the needs of the children in our care.

With a passion for youth development and hands-on learning, Madison brings creativity, organization, and energy to every program. She is committed to fostering a supportive and inspiring environment where children can explore, learn, and grow.
In her free time, Madison enjoys creating designs for her business and spending time with family and friends, reflecting her belief in the importance of balance, curiosity, and community.

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter SC
Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
James Sullivan was born and raised in Augusta, Georgia, and came to know the Lord in June 2005. Rebecca Sullivan, originally from El Dorado, Arkansas, came to know the Lord at the age of 17.

Their love story began on a hot summer day in July 1992 when James, riding a public transit bus in Augusta, Georgia, spotted Rebecca and confidently declared, “That woman is going to be my wife.” Less than a year later, on December 15, 1993, they were married. Their union has been blessed with three children and six grandchildren.

Despite marrying the woman of his dreams, it wasn’t until thirteen years later that James fully surrendered to Christ. After battling a drug addiction that threatened his marriage and future ministry, James turned to The Salvation Army’s Adult Rehabilitation Center (ARC) in Atlanta, Georgia. Since June 2005, he has lived a life free of drugs and alcohol, crediting God for his transformation.

In June 2010, James and Rebecca made the bold decision to sell all their possessions in Augusta and enroll in the Evangeline Booth College Seminary in Atlanta, Georgia. They graduated in 2012 and were commissioned to serve at the Atlanta Peachcrest Corps and Boys & Girls Club.

Their journey took them to Albany, Georgia, in June 2017, where they launched new programs at the Albany Corps and embraced the local community. After five years in Albany, they received a call in June 2022, sending them to Chattanooga, Tennessee. There, they spent two years ministering to the community, focusing on youth and literacy programs.

In June 2024, they were called to Sumter, South Carolina.

Rebecca enjoys hiking, gardening, and vacationing with their children and grandchildren. James, a man of few words, finds joy in fishing, cooking, and watching old westerns. His favorite scripture is John 3:16: “For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.”

Author.Department: Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter SC

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Biography:
Chasity Russell has served as the Director of The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana for the past four years. In this role, she is passionate about creating a safe, engaging, and enriching environment where young people can learn, grow, and discover their potential. Guided by her motto, “If it’s legal, we want it taught at the Red Shield Youth Center,” Chasity is continually expanding programs and experiences that expose youth to new skills, opportunities, and ways of thinking.

Beyond the Youth Center, Chasity is deeply committed to community service. She serves as the President of Pink Behind the Thin Blue Line, a nonprofit organization supporting law enforcement families, and is an active member of the Texarkana Arkansas Citizens Police Academy Alumni Association. She also proudly supports public service through her marriage to Officer Jason Russell of the Texarkana College Police Department.

When she’s not at the Youth Center, Chasity enjoys giving back to the community, spending time with family, and keeping up with her ever-growing group of French Bulldogs—who ensure life is never boring.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Captain Clara Gomez is a dedicated Salvation Army Officer serving the Texarkana Corps. With a strong foundation in social services and youth ministry, Captain Clara brings compassion and dedication to her work. She holds a degree in Christian Arts, enriching her approach to ministry and serving the community. She loves to spend time with her family, read, travel, and find ways to be creative.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
As a child he attended Salvation Army youth
programs in McAllen, Texas. Faith, community & family
have always been at the center of my life. I am fortunate
to share this journey with my wife (Clara). As the
Commanding Officers for The Salvation Army in
Texarkana, together, we navigate the joys and challenges
of administrative and program ministry. I am a proud
father of 4 girls (Hana, Racheal, Amber & Audrey), 1 boy
(Jeremiah) and a grandfather of 5 (Rosalee, Olivia,
Jasmine & Athena). Whether we're enjoying lively game
nights or sharing meals filled with laughter and love,
family time is a priority for me. Like most well informed
Texans, I am a Cowboy, Ranger and Spurs Fan at heart. I
believe that nurturing relationships, both spiritual &
familial, are essential to a fulfilling life. I strive to inspire
others through my work and example. Each day is an
opportunity to connect, serve, and grow. My goal is
simply to be better today than I was yesterday.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography:
Lila Spencer joined the Red Shield Youth Center team in the summer of 2025 and has quickly become an essential part of our youth development staff. From day one, she has brought creativity, compassion, and steady leadership to every program she supports. With a degree in addictions counseling, Lila offers a unique and valuable perspective when working with young people, helping them build healthy coping skills, confidence, and positive relationships.

Highly artistic and hands-on, Lila loves incorporating art, creative projects, and self-expression into daily activities, making learning both fun and meaningful for the kids. She has a genuine heart for each child she serves and is known for her patience, encouragement, and ability to connect with youth of all ages.

As she continues to grow professionally, Lila consistently seeks new ways to strengthen her skills and expand her impact. Her dedication to the mission and to the children and families we serve is evident in everything she does, and we are excited to watch her continue to soar in her role.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Director I

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Biography: My name is Mrs. Brandy, Red Shield Youth Center Director for The Salvation Army in St. Albans, West Virginia. I've been with The Salvation Army since 2018, serving in a wide range of roles including Youth Developmental Professional, Driver, Cook, Secretary, Branch Manager, and Director. This experience gives me a deep, hands-on understanding of youth services and community needs. I'm a recipient of the West Virginia Most Valuable Professional Award and holds a Certification in Mental Health for Youth and Adults. As a dedicated mentor, I'm passionate about supporting young people through critical stages of their lives, particularly during their high school years, and is committed to helping them succeed both academically and personally. Strongly encouraging literacy and helps provides reading intervention support through the Edge program to enhance reading skills and comprehension. Outside of my professional work, my husband of 14 years and I are parents to four wonderful children and are a proud first-time grandparent, who enjoys reading, spending time outdoors, and engaging in arts and crafts.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Program Coordinator I

Biography: My name is Moeka Ueura and I am Program Coordinator for The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of St. Albans, WV. I am an educator with over 5 years of experience working as a tutor and teacher. I have experience teaching students of all ages, from young children to adults. I hold a M.A. in English from Marshall University, with an emphasis in Linguistics, as well as TESOL certification. I am passionate about teaching English because I believe that learning a language expands people's knowledge and deepens their understanding of different cultures and backgrounds. As a Salvationist from Japan, I would like to share the love of God and Spread hope, help to children in various ways.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: My name is Shannon Brown and Im 22 years old and I've been working with the Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center for two summers now and this is my first time working the after school program as a YDP. Working with kids, gives me a motivation to have patience and development as a human being that's why I enjoy doing what I do. Seeing the children learn, grow, and enjoy their childhood while they can make me smile. It's like I did something good which makes a difference and means a lot to me. Just being there for our members and being a mentor or even someone they can look up too. I'm an avid Philadelphia Eagles Fan, loves sports, video games, building Legos with the members, and watching anime.

Biography: My Name is Meredith and I've been with The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center since 2015. My passion was working with the Teens and watching them become young adults and graduating from High School. Once COVID Hit, we lost our Teens as they had become more liable to stay home. Since then, I've became the Membership Clerk and have been in this role for 2 years now. I'm a mother and grandmother who just wants the best for every child possible that I meet.

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director

PositionTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Site Director
Biography: Hi everyone! My name is Daija Hicks! My life’s purpose is rooted in growth—both my own and that of the children I serve. Raised by a single mother who opened her home and heart to foster children, I learned early on the importance of care, community, and resilience. My journey has led me to work with children ages 18 months to 18 years in schools and outdoor spaces, where exploration and creativity thrive. I’m excited to create a fun, purposeful, and youth-centered environment for every child I encounter. Thank you for welcoming me into your space—I can’t wait to grow together.

Author.JobTitle: Divisional Director of Red Shield Youth Centers

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry
Biography: Hi y’all! My name is Andy Scrivner! I’m passionate about understanding today’s generation of youth and supporting them as they grow into confident, capable individuals. Through creativity, movement, and exploration, I strive to influence every young person I work with positively. My goal is to encourage youth to be independent, resilient, and willing to try new things—because when you try everything, you can do anything.

Author.JobTitle: Divisional Director of Red Shield Youth Centers

Title: Edit Staff and Leaders Entry

Person.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I

Biography:
Jaime B. Jones-McCoy has dedicated her life to education and service for nearly three decades. She holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood Development, a Master’s Degree in Urban Education, and a Doctorate in Divinity. Her career spans 28 years in education, where she has made a lasting impact at every level of learning.

Jaime has served as an Adjunct Professor at Oklahoma City Community College, teaching Child Development courses; a classroom teacher working with children from infancy through 8th grade; a Childcare Director for the YMCA; the owner and operator of True Grace Family Learning Center; and a Campus Director for Child Care Associates/Head Start. She now serves as the Executive Director of the Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center in Waxahachie, where she continues to lead with vision, compassion, and faith.

A lifelong Christian, Jaime has been married to her college sweetheart for 28 years and is the proud mother of a 22-year-old son. Her passion for God, education, and community shines through in every role she has held, making her an inspiring leader, mentor, and advocate for children and families.

Author.JobTitle: Red Shield Youth Center Executive Director I
